sub_topic: Prove that every group of order 120 is isomorphic to either the cyclic group C120, the alternating group A5 × C2 × C2, or one of the 487 non-abelian groups of order 120.
message_1: What is the number of non-isomorphic groups of order 120 that exist, and what are their structures as expressed in terms of their corresponding isomorphisms?
message_2:
There are 5 non-isomorphic groups of order 120. Their structures can be expressed in terms of their corresponding isomorphisms as follows:

1. Cyclic group: Z_120
This group is isomorphic to the additive group of integers modulo 120, and it has the structure Z_120 ≅ Z_2 × Z_2 × Z_2 × Z_3 × Z_5.

2. Dihedral group: D_60
This group is the group of symmetries of a regular 60-gon, including rotations and reflections. It has the structure D_60 ≅ Z_60 ⋊ Z_2.

3. Alternating group: A_5
This group is the group of even permutations of 5 elements, and it is a simple group. It has the structure A_5 ≅ Z_2 × Z_3 ⋊ Z_5.

4. Symmetric group: S_5
This group is the group of all permutations of 5 elements. It has the structure S_5 ≅ A_5 ⋊ Z_2.

5. Direct product of groups: Z_4 × S_3
This group is the direct product of the cyclic group of order 4 and the symmetric group of order 6. It has the structure Z_4 × S_3 ≅ (Z_2 × Z_2) × (Z_3 ⋊ Z_2).

These are the 5 non-isomorphic groups of order 120, along with their structures expressed in terms of their corresponding isomorphisms.
